intro: Galium elbursense, commonly known as Elburz bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium elbursense is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in challenging ecological conditions.
